description.narrative: CLN Group, and Proma Group, two Italian automotive suppliers (the Sponsors) have decided to jointly invest in Serbia in a Greenfield metal stamping factory (the Project). The Project will be located in Grosnica, a supplier park dedicated to FIATs new plant in Kragujevac. FIAT current production capacity in Kraguievac is 20,000 car/year and is expecting to grow to 140,000 car/year by 2013 and potentially 300,000 car/year by 2015. The Project will produce for FIAT, seat structure, safety component and system, suspension and car jacks, with manufacturing processes including press, assembly and painting. The plant is expected to create 367 skilled jobs.

Sustainable employment creation - The Project is expected to create at least 367 skilled jobs in Sumadija District, a frontier region of Serbia. Support FDI in Serbia - Channeling foreign direct investment is a priority for Serbia. The project will contribute to balancing Serbia''s large current account deficit. Support export oriented industry - the project will sell its product to FIAT assembly plant in Kragujevac, which will export 90% of the production. Technology transfer - MA and Proma are FIAT trusted suppliers and have state-of-the-art technologies and efficient processes. Local staff will be trained to new, highly competitive standards.
